![Ganghwa Anglican Church (ÎåÄÌïúÏÑ±Í≥µÌöå Í∞ïÌôîÏÑ±Îãπ)](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579082_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Ganghwa Anglican Church was consecrated in 1900 by Charies Jone Corfe, the First Bishop of the Church as the St. Peter and St.Paul‚Äôs Church. The church has since undergone several restorations, but the design remains true to the original.

The two-story 4x10 rectangular building is characterized by traditional Korean construction style on the outside while the interior is a Western Basilica style symbolizing the beauty of harmony and Korean tradition. It was first designated as Gyeonggi-do Tangible Cultural Property No. 154 and then became Incheon Tangible Cultural property when Ganghwa was included in Incheon Metropolitan City. In January 2001 it was designated as Historic Site No.424 of Korea. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-32-930-4571| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579081_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579081_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579084_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579084_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579085_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579085_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579086_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579086_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512660_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512660_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512661_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512661_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512663_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512663_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512665_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512665_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512666_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512666_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512662_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512662_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-32-930-4571](tel:+82329304571) - [üè†www.cha.go.kr](http://www.cha.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.7496574902 longitude: 126.4856636932 title: 10, Gwancheong-gil 27beon-gil, Ganghwa-gun, Incheon ``` ## Directions 1) Sinchon Station (Seoul Subway Line 2), Exit 4.
Go straight 260m to arrive at the bus stop in front of Artreon. From the bus stop, take Bus 3000 to Ganghwa Bus Terminal. Transfer to Bus 88 and get off at Suhyup Bus Stop. (2 bus stops)

2) Yeongdeungpo Station (Seoul Subway Line 1)
Across from Shinsegae Department Store, take Bus 88 and get off at Suhyup Bus Stop.

From the Suhyup Bus Stop, continue walking straight for 400m and take a right at Ganghwa Jungang Market.
Walk for 130m and the church will be on the left.

data.title: Ganghwa Anglican Church (ÎåÄÌïúÏÑ±Í≥µÌöå Í∞ïÌôîÏÑ±Îãπ)
data.description:
Ganghwa Anglican Church was consecrated in 1900 by Charies Jone Corfe, the First Bishop of the Church as the St. Peter and St.Paul‚Äôs Church. The church has since undergone several restorations, but the design remains true to the original.

The two-story 4x10 rectangular building is characterized by traditional Korean construction style on the outside while the interior is a Western Basilica style symbolizing the beauty of harmony and Korean tradition. It was first designated as Gyeonggi-do Tangible Cultural Property No. 154 and then became Incheon Tangible Cultural property when Ganghwa was included in Incheon Metropolitan City. In January 2001 it was designated as Historic Site No.424 of Korea.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Songwol-dong Fairy Tale Village (ÏÜ°ÏõîÎèô ÎèôÌôîÎßàÏùÑ)
dataList.description: Songwol-dong was named for its view of the moon between the pine forest. The opening of Incheon Port in 1883 led to the start of many foreigners coming into the area for settlement. Soon, it became a rich village and many young people gradually moved out, leaving the village in a state of stagnation. As such, a renovation project was brought about to improve the development of the village by painting and decorating classic fairy tales all around.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Songdo Central Park (ÏÜ°ÎèÑ ÏÑºÌä∏Îü¥ÌååÌÅ¨)
dataList.description: The city of Songdo is a futuristic city with buildings like a piece of art. As the first seawater park in the country, Songdo Central Park provides visitors with various water sports including water taxi, canoe, and more. The landmark of Songdo also provides culture and arts throughout the park.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Socheongdo Island (ÏÜåÏ≤≠ÎèÑ)
dataList.description: Socheongdo Island is a small island located approximately 210 kilometers northwest of Incheon. The island is full of oddly formed rocks and visitors can enjoy sea fishing throughout the year. There are two fishing villages on the island with various sea life for fishing.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sinteuri Park (Ïã†Ìä∏Î¶¨Í≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: The city of Bupyeong is surrounded by Gyeyangsan Mountain, Cheolmasan Mountain, and Manwolsan Mountain, which all form a basin-shaped area in the center. Bupyeong slowly began to establish itself as a city after the opening of Gyeongin railway and the U.S. Army base established right after the Korean War. Sinteuri Park in Bupyeong 4(sa)-dong neighborhood is equipped with outdoor recreational facilities including a soccer field, tennis court, badminton court, children's playground, walking trail, and water fountain, spanning an impressive 58,594 „é°. It also has a library with 1,500 seats, and a floor area of 7,869 „é°. The park serves as a main recreational area for Bupyeong residents.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Silmi Beach (Ïã§ÎØ∏Ìï¥ÏàòÏöïÏû•)
dataList.description: Silmi Beach, also known as Keunmuri Beach, is located on Muuido Island. The clean, sandy beach stretches out beautifully against the backdrop of a lush pine tree forest so dense that it does not let daylight in, even at midday. Facing the beach is Silmido Island, the location for the filming of Silmido (2003), a Korean movie based on the tragic story of Korean Special Ops Unit 684. The film set, however, was demolished after the shooting. The pathway to the island, which has no residents, can be shown during low tide. Therefore, visitors should be aware of the tidal times to know when they can cross back to the mainland.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seonnyeo Rock (ÏÑ†ÎÖÄÎ∞îÏúÑ)
dataList.description:
Seonnyeo Rock is located near the Seoul metropolitan area, in the northern part of Yongyudo Island, past Masian Beach. The rock is named after the myth that a fairy came down on a rainbow to play on the beach. Artists come to recreate the scenery of the sharp rock against the ocean on their canvas as they listen to the waves crash. The beach is also popular among tourists at sunset, when the fading sun colors the sea around the rock.
On the other side is a small dock and old fishing boats. This beach is less crowded than Wangsan Beach or those in Eurwang-ri, making it the perfect spot for swimming and camping.
There is a pretty cafe up the hill from the rock and it is a great place for enjoying the ocean scenery with a cup of tea. On the other side of the cafe is a garden with pine trees, yet another beautiful spot to watch the sunset.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seongmodo Island (ÏÑùÎ™®ÎèÑ)
dataList.description: Seongmodo Island, located 1.2 kilometers west of Ganghwado Island, is a popular destination for families and those looking for relaxation. The island has various mountains as well as a 41.8 kilometer coastal road.
dataList.author: korea-tour
